conditions.name: Dose Titration Safety Review
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before dose titration to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: Outpatient Period Extension
conditions.description: The Outpatient Period may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.
conditions.text: To ensure flexibility, the Outpatient Period during Treatment Period 1 may be extended up to an additional 14 days with Investigator approval.

conditions.name: Dose Titration Safety Hold
conditions.description: Participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study if there are safety concerns.
conditions.text: participants may remain on the 15 mg/day dose for the duration of the study.

conditions.name: Rechallenge Limit
conditions.description: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed following a dose modification.
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

transitionRules.name: Scheduled Dose Titration
transitionRules.text: Participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Elevated Transaminases
transitionRules.text: ALT or AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN requires temporary interruption of dosing.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Hepatotoxicity
transitionRules.text: ALT or AST > 5x ULN requires discontinuation of study intervention.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Anemia
transitionRules.text: Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL requires dose reduction to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Thrombocytopenia
transitionRules.text: Platelets < 100,000/mm3 requires dose reduction to previous dose level or 15 mg QOD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: Neutrophils > 30% decrease from baseline and below reference range requires dose reduction.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Hy's Law Precursor
transitionRules.text: Bilirubin > 2x ULN accompanied by ALT > 3x ULN requires temporary interruption.

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification for Neurologic Worsening
transitionRules.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment requires evaluation for dose modification.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if pregnancy or planned pregnancy occurs.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Discontinuation for Severe Adverse Event
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for serious hypersensitivity reaction or severe uncontrolled infection.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day based on safety review.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Ongoing Dose Modification Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point for dose modification (interruption, reduction) based on emergent safety data (e.g., lab results, AEs) as per dose modification criteria.
